title: How to come up with programming blog ideas - Quora

response.answer_text: Having programming as your day job means you’d be solving a number of problems over the course of a week - debugging some obscure bug in your project, hacking an open source library to fit your need, performing some heroic refactoring moves, etc. You could tell the world about these things through your blog. How many times have you banged your head on your desk trying to figure something out only to laugh at yourself in the end after it turns out all you had to do was something stupidly simple? Tell your story to everyone! Personally I enjoy writing about production and scaling issues we have as they can make really good stories. Still if you’re not able to come up with an idea, you can always write a tutorial on the latest JavaScript MVC framework. But seriously, dont!

Just like any blog if you are involved in the topic, you write about: What is missing? How do you fill that gap?What is broken and how do you fix it?Successes and challenges in your programming worldHow-TosPolls (as mentioned earlier)SurveysTranscribed interviews with other programmersCode snippets/Github linksAdvice about…job searches, hiring programmers, careers for programmers, learning a programming language, certifications that matter, collaborating with others (including non-programmers), managing a team of programmers, etc.
